text:
Microsoft should reaffirm this long-term commitment for the next decade whatever
the context, challenges and new technology disruption/new marketing heaven (AI,
quantum computing...) 
I mean we should stick to the big picture, applaud their effort in bringing such
a commitment for "patch management" over 2 decades.
We should thank them for listening administrators and provide the right (and
almost free) tools to help them implement the "patch management" sanity
practice.
Patch management isn't going away, it'll go on harder and stronger.
Consumer and corporate IT are so much more vulnerable without a proper patch
management practice. 
PS: I remember Blaster in August 2003
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blaster_(computer_worm)
